quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy’s coming back today! Andy’s coming back today! Ha! Andy’s coming back today. David Wallace sent him on an outward bound wilderness adventure for a whole month to make him more decisive and confident. He sent his own son too. And the counselors said they both grew up, big time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How was my summer? It was pretty mixed. I invented a new power drink made out of beet runoff. Mmm, mmm! So that’s really good. But I got some disappointing medical news.

quotes.speaker: Doctor
quotes.line: Mr. Schrute, the results are in. You are not the father.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I told you [Dwight vomits power drink on Angela]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, what a summer! An emotional roller-coaster. I ran over a turtle in the parking lot, but then I saved him by gluing his shell back together. But I’m not that good at puzzles.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [as Kevin reassembles shell] That piece doesn’t go there. [Kevin shushes him]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: So I patched him with stuff from around the office. But I couldn’t get the pieces to fit right. Then one day, when I was reaching for the glue, I crushed his shell again. But I rebuilt him even better that time. But it turned out the turtle was already day. Probably when I ran over him the first time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: For us, um, nothing new, really the kids are great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You are really good at modesty. She’s a genius.  She painted this incredible mural in the kids’ room. There’s a hippo leading a parade of 500 children—

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kay, well, you had that interesting thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, yeah

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, Jim’s friend is starting anew company based on this idea Jim had when they were back in college.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Its sports marketing basically. But the athletes are partners.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And he wanted Jim to be a part of it too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: In Philly, so, that doesn’t really work for the family. Watch this guy make a billion dollars off my idea.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He said if it takes off he’s gonna buy us a new car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: An Altima or better.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Kelly Kapoor is gone. Her fiancé Ravi was hired as a pediatrics professor at Miami university.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [tossing out winter coats] I don’t need em anymore. I am going to Miami biotches. To hang with Lebron James and Gloria Estefan.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Miami University in Ohio. On her last day, Kelly was still a little confused about it

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Enjoy the snow losers.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I’m so happy for you Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Shortly after Kelly left, Ryan quit and also moved to Ohio, for what he claimed were unrelated reasons.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I’ve actually done a lot of market research and it actually turns out that southwestern Ohio is going to be the next Silicon Valley. They call it the Silicon Prairie. It’s a big university town. And, uh, that’s not garbage, it’s out clothes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And that was our summer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: we good?

quotes.speaker: Off-camera
quotes.line: Yeah

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don’t you guys have everything. I mean, its just a paper company.

quotes.speaker: Off-camera
quotes.line: Well we’re more following you guys, to see how you turn out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, because we were kind of dramatic in the beginning. Well I don’t think anything’s gonna change in our lives now. With work and two kids there’s just-nothing interesting is going to happen for us in a long, long time.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy’s coming back today!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Hey, uh, does anybody know where we throw these out?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh, my god. It’s called a garbage can.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Helpless.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: There’s two new guys back there with me now. They’re in their 20s. And we really get along.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: [Playing computer game with Toby] You’re looking good.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Just three single guys. Getting into trouble.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: They’re like the new Jim and Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, yes, yes I see that! Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey, new Jim, come sit on my face.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: No thank you. My name’s Pete.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, Pete is not the new Jim. The only we have in common is that neither of us wants to sit on Meredith’s face.  And if that  makes him the new Jim, then every human being in the world is the new Jim.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy’s here! Old Dwight, new Dwight, Andy’s here. New Jim, Tuna, Andy’s here. Pam, he’s here. [squeals as Andy walks in]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey! Wow, I thought about this place a lot when I was on solo. Three days on a mountain, it’ll change you. The things we think we need. Clocks, yeah right!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: It sounds amazing, tell us all about it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What’re you still doing here?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Wonderful, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You know I had this really funny dream during Outward Bound that you died.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Brilliant.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: See me in my office later. The new guys, alright. It’s Clark and, um—

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Pete!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: In Outward Bound it was all about nicknames. They called me Iceman. You will be called Plop.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: What? Why?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Cause you’re always taking dumps.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: No I’m not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Come on, everybody defecates. Relax, Plop. And you will be called Fart cause you fart all the time.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Actually, Andy, we call this one Dwight, Jr.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: No, I prefer Fart.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, Dwight Jr. Infinitely better. You guys look exactly alike. Dwight go stand next to him. This is insane.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don’t see it.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I don’t either.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoa! Mind blown. It’s like father and son! Dwight, you cool if we call him Dwight Jr?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, yes I am. [puts his arm around Clark]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight, Jr! [Dwight gives Clark a noogie]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: In a way it’s like I have a son. And who knows? Maybe someday they’ll hire someone who looks like a younger version of him. And then I’ll have a grandson.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Well, I need to give my cat up for adoption.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: The one who uses the doorbell, or the one with the Mexican hat, or the one with the rain galoshes, or the one you let go around naked?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Angela’s cats are cute. So cute that you just want to eat them. But you can’t eat cats. You can’t eat cats, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, the one with the long hair and the denim pants, Comstock! Ok, look [starts playing video on computer]. He’s such a special kitty. I just want to find him a good home. He loves those pants

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I’ll take him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Please, after the turtle?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I am enormously proud of what I did for that turtle!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oscar, Oscar, will you take him?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No, I’m a dog person.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: If you pray enough, you can change yourself into a cat person.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Those guys always change back, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: David, outward bound was incredible. I was the best at slack lining, I ate a worm.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Glad to hear it. You sound very confident and decisive.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey you wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, I gotta go David. [hangs up phone] Why is Nellie still here?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You can only fire Nellie for cause.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Mm, then I will make up a cause.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Except you just told me you were gonna make it up. Now if she sues, I have to testify against you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Then forget I just told you that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Can’t. I took a course at the Weintraub Memory Academy. I sat next to this woman named Beverly Brook. She had a Greek salad for lunch. See what I mean?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Now I know why Michael hated you so much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good boy, getting big and strong. Snack foods!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Yep, body by Cheez-it

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ah, humor. I have it too. I have a couple tickets to the slayer concert 10 months from now. You interested?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I think I’m busy that night. Or I would.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, we’re both just kinda learning as we go, aren’t we?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Learning what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just how this going to be, you know? You have a beautiful round head.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Kay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So what kind of farming you into, huh? You more of a fruit man or a root man?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Is this—is this like code for gay stuff? Cause if so, that’s totally fine. Like, I’m fine with it. But you should know that I’m into the ladies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Spoken like a true root man.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: You know, if you’re ever swamped, I could make some sales calls for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My calls?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: So could you give me a list of all your clients? Or just the leads that you haven’t had time to pursue yet?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You want a list of my clients? You want my leads?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Yeah, I’ll just give it a glance—

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I’ll give it a read.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: With my leads and stuff like that?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Cause you’re interested in going into sales?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I am.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wow, that’s great. That’s great. Ok, good, let’s talk about that, ok?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You’re not getting my clients! Nice try.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Paranoid? I’m not familiar with the word. And I really don’t have time to learn new words right now, ok? A pudgy 22-year-old is trying to take my job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, get ready for the battle of your life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Done. Explain.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The new guys. Dwight Jr is after  my job. Yeah. There is a shark hiding inside that adorable little cherub.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, now I get what Pete was talking about at the sales meeting yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, sales—what sales meeting?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The new guys called one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The new guys called a sales meeting?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Clark ended the whole thing with a karate demonstration. Did you know there was a belt above black?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There’s no belt above black. Is there a belt above black?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You should ask him. It’s a color you would never expect. [Dwight storms off] Too easy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Attention everyone. Comstock is still available. Oscar has been flirting with adopting him. But still hasn’t given me a definite yes or no.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Definitely no.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Fine. For any interested candidates, I will be conducting 20 minute interviews. My ideal situation would an independently wealthy cute couple with a strong commitment to education. Black or white, I’m fine with either, but not both. [to Pam] Listen, you’re in this, but you need to wow me, ok?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I wanted to talk to you about our working relationship this year. It’s going to be terrible.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Not necessarily

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No I’m going to make sure that it is. And if it isn’t, I’m going to take immediate action to rectify that. Now, I don’t like to throw around the b-word, but I’m going to be a huge bitch to you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Now this is called slack lining.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I set up the old slack line to teach the office the skills of focus and discipline. Or in the case of certain individuals, the skills of humiliation and looking really dumb.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: If you make it all the way across, your confidence will soar. But, if you Toby out, then you’ll feel like a real Nellie. How about a hand, screw those guys. Now, these are my actual Outward Bound counselors, Rafe and Feather.

quotes.speaker: Rafe
quotes.line: Iceman.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That’s me. The powder is for your protection, Feather has permanent athlete’s foot. Feather, show them how you dance upon the line of slack.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You a sports fan?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Sure, boxing, tennis.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh. Any team sports?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: NASCAR. The Amazing Race.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Phillies fan, though, right?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: You mean horses?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, like baseball. A baseball team.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Ah, I like the Red Sox. I’m from Vermont.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok. Good talk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I have nothing in common with Plop.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: All right, who’s next? Nellie?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, I would rather watch you and your talented friends.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Nonsense. Get up here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Go ahead

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Come on. Uh, are you gonna wear your heels?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I’m very self-conscious about my feet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ok, sure. There ya go. Atta girl. Hey, alright. Whoa! [pushes Nellie off slack line] You suck. Alright, who’s next? Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: This seems like the kind of thing white people with dreadlocks do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight Jr? This looks like your speed.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Uh, I guess I could give it shot.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, come on. Get up here. Just hop on up.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Ok

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Focus on the horizon. [Clark successfully walks the slack line] Whoa! Look at this guy.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I’ve always been good at anything that required balance. My doctor says I have gigantic inner ears.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Go, Dwight Jr!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Boo, unimpressed. It’s a tightrope for babies. Boo!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Alright, let’s see you do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright. Let me show you how a real man walks across a flaccid cord.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ooh! Who ordered the hot apple fail?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok, I am just getting started, ok?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: You got this, it’s all you. [as Dwight repeatedly fails and gets smacked around] Got ourselves a yard sale. Balls in face. It’s not a race, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well it’s official. Old Dwight is lame and New Dwight is cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [bleeding heavily from the mouth] That’s not true.  Just give me another chance.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: But your mouth is ble—

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: This is a bloodbath. Alright, I’m calling this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It is enough of this. Everyone, let’s go back to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is a stupid activity. I would be embarrassed to be good at it. [tries to go in locked door] Idiots.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Slack lining, please. Untie that rope, give it to a couple of pig-tailed school girls, let them start jumping with it while chanting a rhyme and giggling about boys. Doesn’t seem so macho now, does it? It’s a jump rope!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam? Hey come up here, up the ladder. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [sees trapeze contraption] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come here, I’ll show you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Why do you want this cat?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I don’t want it, really.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: How would you support the cat? What are your ambitions?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I want to start my own business. I want to be a millionaire. Lots of things. Travel, make the world a better place, earn an MBA at night.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Have you taken any concrete steps?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Well, I’m still just fitting in here, you know? Getting used to the new job. But, definitely on the agenda. But that is a good idea, Angela. I should make a list.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, come on, Pete! God, that’s just sad. If he doesn’t watch himself, he’s gonna be here for years, doing nothing. [sober realization] Wow, maybe Pete is the new Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Do you see how the trapeze completely surrounds the wire? That means it’s literally impossible for anyone to fall off. So you will merely sit below and be my counterweight as I pedal across the parking lot to that telephone pole.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I will?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You will. Yeah we weigh about the same, wouldn’t you say?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure, if you weigh 105 pounds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So you’ll do it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on, this will be the only thrill of your boring life.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight, you may find this hard to believe, but I love my boring life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Exactly the way it is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, and there’s nothing you could say that would get me to run the slightest risk of losing it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Please? Please, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Find someone else, I don’t know. Ask Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I can’t use Phyllis. Are you kidding me? The moment she steps off this bar I’ll be launched into space. God, you’re so insensitive.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Why are you getting rid of it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Allergies.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Your husband?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, the baby. Please, it’s my husband’s favorite cat. He’s broken up about it. It’s the only time I’ve seen him cry other than our wedding night.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You know what? I will take Comstock.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Really? Oh, Oscar, thank you!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I’ll come by after work and pick him up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yay! Oh, poor Robert. He won’t get to say goodbye. He has this business dinner tonight

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: C’est la vie.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Please don’t teach the cat French.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [on phone] Yeah. Good news, tonight when you come over for dinner, you can play with your old buddy Comstock.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah. You know what? I’ll meet you down there. Just gotta make a quick call.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Kay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok. [prepares bike trapeze]Oh, god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Attention, employees of Dunder Mifflin. Everyone thinks the new guys are so cool cause they can slack line. Boo. Hey Clark, this is what a areal salesman looks like. They say that you only live once and I’m about to prove it. Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, man. It’s halpert. Did you go to the other guy yet? Great, don’t. I’m in. Yeah, yep, I’m all in. Ok, talk to you soon. Bye. [hangs up] Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Woo! [starts pedaling out until trapeze bike flips over, he dangles from the handlebars] Ahh!!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: In the parking lot today there was a circus. The copier did tricks on the high-wire, a lady tried to give away a baby that looked like a cat. There was a Dwight impersonator and a Jim impersonator; a strong man crushed a turtle. I laughed and I cried. Not bad for a day in the life of a dog food company.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Crap. Sorry, Nellie.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Once again, I understand that old habits die hard, but if everyone would kindly walk their refuse to the trash bins instead of tossing them, then we would—[hit in the face with trash]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Mm, swish.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, it’s nothing to do with me. I just happen to be sitting near to where the bins are.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: There are two things that I am passionate about. Recycling and revenge.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: [As trash is thrown at her] Fluke.
